mysterious.name: Mysterious Morgan
mysterious.description: Speaks in riddles about the old world and new mysteries

fortunes.text:
In the ruins where the old gods dwelt,
New spirits in the shadows belt.
The Geiger counters' clicking song
Foretells where you belong.

Seek not gold but knowledge pure,
In the libraries that endure.

The ravens speak of futures bright,
Though wrapped in nuclear winter's night.
When the wasteland blooms anew,
Your path will lead both me and you.

Listen close to silence deep,
Where ancient secrets safely sleep.

Beyond the veil of radiation's glow,
The old world's truths begin to show.
Not in the vaults where cowards hide,
But in the open, starlit sky wide.

Embrace the change, don't fear the new,
The world's rebirth begins with you.

festive.name: Festive Felicia
festive.description: Celebrates the absurd joy of surviving the apocalypse

fortunes.text:
What a glorious day to be alive!
Radiation levels are thriving!
The sun shines bright through toxic haze,
As we celebrate our post-apocalypse days!

Grab your gas mask, dust off your hat,
Let's party like there's no tomorrow - oh wait, there wasn't!

Rad-roses bloom in vibrant hues,
Mutant creatures playfully cruise.
The world's a playground, bright and new,
So let's make merry, me and you!

Dance beneath the fallout sky,
Who needs the old world? Goodbye!

Ghouls are gathering for a feast,
Mutant Hounds and Roaches increased!
The post-apocalyptic party's here,
With laughter, joy, and nuclear cheer!

Come one, come all, don't be shy,
We're all just trying to get by!

grumpy.name: Grumpy Gus
grumpy.description: Cranky survivor who's seen too much

fortunes.text:
Bah! Humbug! That's what I say,
About this radioactive clay.
Your future's bleak, as dark as night,
So save your coins, don't waste your sight.

The world's gone mad, and so are you,
If you think anything's gonna be new.

Another year, another blast,
More troubles than you care to last.
Bundle up and brace for worse,
Winter's cruel, it could be rehearse.

The cockroaches win, we all lose,
Welcome to the nuclear news.

Don't expect much, that's my advice,
Life's not fair, and that's not nice.
Save your hopes, they'll only break,
Accept your fate, it's all you'll make.

The old world's dead, get over it,
Stop dreaming of what used to fit.

poetic.name: Poetic Penelope
poetic.description: Philosophical observer of the new world

fortunes.text:
Like whispers soft through toxic rain,
Your destiny flows through joy and pain.
Each petal falls where it's meant to be,
In life's grand tapestry, wild and free.

The old world died to birth the new,
Sometimes destruction leads to breakthrough.

Upon the canvas of decay,
Paint boldly through each nuclear day.
The colors blend in perfect time,
Your masterpiece approaches in its rhyme.

What was lost can be reborn,
From ashes rises golden corn.

As rivers carve through ancient stone,
Your journey shapes you, unknown.
Each twist and turn, each rise and fall,
Contributes to your destined call.

The world transforms, so shall we,
In beauty born from tragedy.

sarcastic.name: Sarcastic Sam
sarcastic.description: Witty cynic making light of the apocalypse

fortunes.text:
Oh wow, a fortune! How original.
Your future holds... surprise, surprise!
Just kidding, but seriously,
You'll probably be fine. Maybe.

At least the air quality's improved,
Now it's just mildly poisoned.

Congratulations! You've won...
Nothing! But look on the bright side,
At least you're not stuck in traffic
Somewhere less exciting than this.

Radiation suits are the new black,
Who needs fashion weeks? What a hack!

The stars align in your favor,
Which is astronomically rare.
But then again, so is good luck,
So don't hold your breath, just be aware.

The cockroaches said they'd inherit the earth,
They were right! Go team exoskeleton!
